citation.abstract: Rates of powder cocaine and crack use have fluctuated among adolescents over recent decades. Little attention has been paid to recent trends, particularly regarding differences between users of powder cocaine and crack-two forms of the substance that are commonly reported together as "cocaine" use, despite having different effects and rates of adverse outcomes.
citation.journal: American Journal of Drug & Alcohol Abuse
citation.title: Demographic and socioeconomic correlates of powder cocaine and crack use among high school seniors in the United States
